noteParagraph.text: Alkali metals: Li, Na, K, Rb, Cs, Fr
Alkaline earth metals: Ca, Sr, Ba, Ra
Lanthanides: elements with atomic numbers 57 to 71 inclusive
Actinides: elements with atomic numbers 89 to 103 inclusive
Refractory metals: Ti, V, Cr, Zr, Nb, Mo, Hf, Ta, W
Halogens: F, Cl, Br, I, At
Noble gases: He, Ne, Ar, Kr, Xe, Rn
Platinum group: Os, Ir, Pt, Ru, Rh, Pd
Noble metals: Ag, Au, Platinum group
Light metals: alkali metals, alkaline earth metals, Be, Al, Mg
Heavy metals: metals other than light metals
Non-metals: H, B, C, Si, N, P, O, S, Se, Te, noble gases, halogens
Transition elements: elements with atomic numbers 21 to 30 inclusive, 39 to 48 inclusive, 57 to 80 inclusive, 89 upwards

titlePart.text: TREATMENT OF ALLOYS OR NON-FERROUS METALS
titlePart.entryReference: general methods or devices for heat treatment of ferrous or non-ferrous metals or alloys
production of metals by electrolysis or electrophoresis
making metallic powder or suspensions thereof

noteParagraph.text: In this sub-class, groups for obtaining metals include obtaining the metals by non-metallurgical processes, and obtaining metal compounds by metallurgical processes. Thus, for example, group covers the production of silver by reduction of ammoniacal silver oxide in solution, and group includes the production of cadmium oxide by a metallurgical process. Furthermore, although compounds of arsenic and antimony are classified in , production of the elements themselves is included in , as well as the production of their compounds by metallurgical processes.

titlePart.text: Preliminary treatment of ores or scrap
Removing sulphur, phosphorus or arsenic, other than by roasting
in sintering machines with movable grates
with carbonaceous material for the production of coked agglomerates
Cooling of roasted, sintered, or agglomerated ores
Extraction of metal compounds from ores by wet methods
Electrothermal treatment of ores or metallurgical products for obtaining metals or alloys
titlePart.entryReference: general methods of refining or remelting metals

titlePart.text: General methods of reducing to metals
by aluminium, other metals, or silicon
with volatilisation or condensation of the metal being produced
Working-up raw materials other than ores, e.g. scrap, to produce non-ferrous metals or compounds thereof
General methods of refining or remelting metals
Refining by liquating, filtering, centrifuging, distilling or supersonic wave action
Refining by treating with gases, e.g. gas flushing
with heating by wave energy or particle radiation
Separating metals from lead by precipitating, e.g. by Parkes process
Separating metals from lead by crystallising, e.g. by Pattison process
with leaching with acids and salt solutions
with leaching with ammonia or ammonia-salt solutions
Obtaining zinc otherwise than by distilling
with leaching with alkaline solutions, e.g. ammonia
Refining solutions obtained by leaching zinc ores
Obtaining alkali, alkaline earth metals or magnesium
Obtaining alkaline earth metals or magnesium
Obtaining metals of atomic number 87 or higher, i.e. radioactive metals
Obtaining thorium, uranium or other actinides
Obtaining metals not elsewhere provided for in this sub-class
